Reviews.Title: Good If You Need "Training Wheels"
Reviews.Author: Happy Camper
Reviews.Content: Having sadly left BlackBerry for an Android platform I felt I needed a true QWERTY keyboard.  I very soon found out how easy a touch screen was to operate and seldom bothered sliding out the keyboard.I do like the durability of the Merge.  One of its downsides, weight, is probably also its redeeming quality.  Since it practically lives in my pocket, the heft is sometime a problem.  This is even more evident if the phone is in a shirt pocket, it'll droop and sag under the weight.All in all, it's not a bad unit and is pretty easy to navigate.  I especially hated to say that just after giving up my beloved BlackBerry.

Reviews.Title: Not unlocked,
Reviews.Author: M. Campbell
Reviews.Content: It caused a lot of problems to have the phone, registered to an Alaskan number, unlocked.  It still reverts to the old number when switched to global.  What a pain.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone.
Reviews.Author: Misti Norris
Reviews.Content: I like the phone.  The slider keyboard is good.  I don't need anything fancy and it fits my need perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Good, for the average user
Reviews.Author: Random person
Reviews.Content: When i first got this phone, it was perfect, fast, and very good for making calls, ETC...But after about of month of using it, it slowed down quite a bit.  I tried installing a different rom and that might of caused it to act this way, but it keeps freezing, crashing, light sensor doesn't work properly anymore.  Android 2.2 is a bit outdated and you cannot update it past 2.2, which is bad if your a person who wants it constantly updated, and running the latest version. If your just making calls, texting, maybe a light browsing on the go, this would be a perfect phone for you.(One other thing, to activate this on verizon you do NOT need a sim card in the phone, which i thought it did.... hope this helped someone).

Reviews.Title: Not as user friendly as we'd like
Reviews.Author: Mishell Magnusson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for an 18 year.  She has said she hates it because it isn't as user friendly as her last phone and seems cumbersome to get on the internet.
